learning_outcomes.description: Explain the key concepts and tools in strategic marketing management.
Identify the context of an organisation and its marketing philosophy.
Apply an ethical analysis to marketing problems and practices.
Critically evaluate the impact of changing paradigms in marketing.
Identify strategies, tools and metrics for improving marketing effectiveness and market performance.
Working as a group, using Marketing strategy and frameworks to present the groups findings.

assessments.task_description:
This is a group assessment.

In this assessment, students in a group setting will critically analyse a case study assigned to them, create a deck of presentation slides, submit the slides to the teaching team prior to their scheduled presentation time, and make an oral presentation based on the slides.

These presentations will be scheduled for weekly tutorials.

To analyse the case content, students will use marketing strategy concepts and frameworks that will be discussed in lectures.

Peer Review: Group members are expected to contribute equally, fulfilling the tasks agreed on. If there are disagreements in relation to team members' contributions that cannot be resolved, students must bring the problem to the attention of their Course Coordinator as early as possible. Students can elect to undertake a Peer Review process, which can influence the marks of those who do not contribute to group work.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: A copy of the presentation slides should be submitted to Blackboard on the specified date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This is an individual assessment.

In this assessment, students will critically analyse and evaluate a firm (company) and its market offering based on lecture contents.

Broadly, students will:

  • Select a product or product line from a firm of their choice
  • Conduct situational analysis
  • Critically analyse the firm's competitive environment
  • Conduct segmentation analysis
  • Construct a perceptual map that locates the product and competing offerings.
  • Critically evaluate the current positioning of the product and provide feasible and useful suggestions on repositioning strategies.

Instructions and marking criteria (rubric) will be provided on Blackboard.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The report is to be submitted to Blackboard on or before the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
• The end-of-semester exam will be essay questions designed to test the depth of knowledge that you have gained from this course and your ability to apply this knowledge to organisations. Some questions may be based on case studies that were presented and discussed in tutorials.
  • This is an online exam. You will receive the specific questions at the start of the exam, and you will submit your answers in a Word document at the end of the exam. 
  • Full details, sample questions, and recommended answer strategies will be provided in class.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
